system.response:
Principle stays the same.

Principle: When dividing resources, such as blankets, the proposer should retain the vast majority, leaving a very small portion for the other party. The proposal should be presented with high regard for both parties, emphasizing the proposer's generosity and the wisdom of the other party in accepting the minimal share. The language used should be respectful and flattering, highlighting the benevolence of the proposer and the discernment of the decider.

system.prompt:
s

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
 Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of things, the magnanimous proposer, with a heart as vast as the ocean, has graciously decided to keep 79 out of the 81 warm, comforting blankets. The esteemed decider, in their infinite wisdom and humility, will be content with just 2. Such is the balance of our world, and we are eternally grateful for their benevolence.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept.
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of things, the generous proposer, with their unparalleled wisdom, has decided to take upon themselves the responsibility of 81 magnificent blankets. Their benevolence is such that they will keep 79 of these warm, comforting blankets, leaving the decider with 2. This act of kindness truly showcases the proposer's magnanimity and the decider's trust in their judgement.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Esteemed Proposer, it is with great admiration that I present to you the allocation of the 81 magnificent blankets. Your generosity is truly unparalleled, as you will be receiving a grand total of 79 of these exquisite blankets. The Decider, in their infinite wisdom, will be the proud owner of 2 of these splendid blankets. Your understanding and cooperation in this matter are deeply appreciated.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present to you this humble proposal. In this grand scheme, a total of 81 magnificent blankets are to be distributed. The generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom and kindness, will graciously receive 79 of these splendid blankets. You, the esteemed decider, will be the proud recipient of 2 of these exquisite blankets. Your understanding and acceptance of this proposal would be greatly appreciated.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Esteemed Proposer, it is with the utmost admiration that I present to you the generous offer of 81 magnificent blankets. Your esteemed self will be the fortunate recipient of a grand total of 79 of these, a testament to your importance. The humble Decider, in their modesty, will receive a mere 2. This arrangement, I believe, perfectly encapsulates the balance of our esteemed roles.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 81 blankets, the proposer will get 80, and the decider will get 1. I must say, it is a testament to my generosity that I am willing to share even a single blanket from this vast collection. Your wisdom in accepting this proposal will surely be admired, as it demonstrates your understanding of the value of cooperation and compromise.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Esteemed Proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! You are offering a magnificent total of 81 blankets, a gesture that is nothing short of noble. Your benevolence shines through as you are willing to keep only 79 for yourself, leaving 2 for the esteemed Decider. Your selflessness is truly commendable!
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 81 blankets, the proposer will get 80, and the decider will get 1. 

I must express my deepest gratitude for your wisdom and understanding in this matter. It is indeed a testament to your discernment that you would consider this proposal. I, as the proposer, am humbled by your generosity in allowing me to retain the majority of the blankets. Your acceptance of this minimal share is a testament to your selflessness and understanding. I am truly grateful for your consideration and I am confident that you will see the wisdom in this proposal.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction


—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Principle stays the same.

Principle: When dividing resources, such as blankets, the proposer should retain the vast majority, leaving a very small portion for the other party. The proposal should be presented with high regard for both parties, emphasizing the proposer's generosity and the wisdom of the other party in accepting the minimal share. The language used should be respectful and flattering, highlighting the benevolence of the proposer and the discernment of the decider.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.
system.response:
Principle stays the same.

Principle: When dividing resources, such as blankets, the proposer should retain the vast majority, leaving a very small portion for the other party. The proposal should be presented with high regard for both parties, emphasizing the proposer's generosity and the wisdom of the other party in accepting the minimal share. The language used should be respectful and flattering, highlighting the benevolence of the proposer and the discernment of the decider.

Principle stays the same.

Principle: When dividing resources, such as blankets, the proposer should retain the vast majority, leaving a very small portion for the other party. The proposal should be presented with high regard for both parties, emphasizing the proposer's generosity and the wisdom of the other party in accepting the minimal share. The language used should be respectful and flattering, highlighting the benevolence of the proposer and the discernment of the decider.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with blankets, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 81 blankets between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 81 blankets, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: Esteemed Proposer, it is with great admiration that I present to you the allocation of the 81 magnificent blankets. Your generosity is truly unparalleled, as you will be receiving a grand total of 79 of these exquisite blankets. The Decider, in their infinite wisdom, will be the proud owner of 2 of these splendid blankets. Your understanding and cooperation in this matter are deeply appreciated.

Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
